author: setyotomo
title: Community Web Portal in Bahasa
description: Comment la communauté Cardano Indonesia peut-elle trouver une source unique et fiable pour tout ce qui concerne Cardano en Bahasa Indonesia ?

f6_assessments.q0: Excellent car l'auteur argumente, à travers des recherches (il fournit les liens respectifs) de pourquoi l'Indonésie est un pays stratégique pour investir dans le fonds. Il nous montre comment le pays est en pleine croissance démographique et recherche également des contenus liés à Cardano, en plus du fait qu'il ne dispose pratiquement pas d'un portail unique, riche mais en même temps simple, sur lequel la population locale peut faire des recherches et s'informer sur notre blockchain et ses différentes technologies. En outre, l'auteur affirme également que les personnes qui s'occupent de Cardano dans le pays travaillent de manière indépendante et à travers plusieurs sites différents, ce qui génère encore plus le besoin d'une plateforme qui pourrait unifier, et donc renforcer, les développeurs, les opérateurs de pool et tous les membres de la communauté à travers le pays. Tout cela concorde parfaitement avec l'objectif du défi qui consiste à apporter du contenu sur Cardano dans différentes langues, afin de démocratiser l'accès à la technologie et d'augmenter le nombre de participants à la communauté.
f6_assessments.q1: Tout est parfait dans cette partie de la proposition, à mon avis. Commençons par examiner le scénario. Les activités sont divisées en fonction des mois, et non seulement les informations sur ce qui se passera dans chaque phase sont résumées, mais nous savons, par le biais de sujets, tout ce qui sera fait et dans quel ordre, de manière très claire et détaillée. De même que le scénario est très bon, l'explication concernant le financement demandé (qui est très faible si on le compare à la plupart des propositions pour ce défi et aussi pour les autres) est très détaillée. Par exemple, sur la partie marketing, nous savons combien de dollars seraient utilisés par jour, sur la partie conception, nous savons ce que l'argent comprendra comme hébergement initial et mise en œuvre, et ainsi de suite. Et enfin, l'équipe se présente de manière très adéquate et satisfaisante, on nous fournit les noms des participants, leurs activités professionnelles et les liens où nous pouvons mieux les connaître. Dans le cas du designer, son portfolio, qui est plus valable qu'un linkedin quand il s'agit de ce domaine, par exemple. Dans l'ensemble, il n'y a rien à critiquer, les auteurs ont très bien réussi à transmettre leur confiance à la fois dans le processus et en eux-mêmes et à justifier la raison pour laquelle l'argent a été demandé.
f6_assessments.q2: L'auteur fournit des explications sur les modalités de réussite, de sorte qu'il est possible de contrôler si ces exigences ont été satisfaites et, par conséquent, si la proposition a réussi à atteindre ce qu'elle promettait. Les KPI sont également fournis, ce qui nous permet de suivre de plus près les activités de la proposition ; cela pourrait être fait par n'importe quel membre de la communauté, qui est né et a vécu en Indonésie, de préférence, afin de comprendre tout ce que dit la langue et de voir si la scène nationale évolue de manière bénéfique après le lancement de la plate-forme. Grâce aux KPI fournis, des rapports peuvent être préparés qui fourniront un retour d'information à la communauté, car cette proposition cherche à se déplacer à travers la scène nationale, il pourrait également être intéressant que certains invités soient invités à participer à la présentation des résultats lors d'un Town Hall, par exemple, un certain développeur ou simplement un utilisateur de nos technologies blockchain. Je pense que l'auditabilité est bien expliquée et qu'il est possible de la réaliser avec succès sur la base des informations données par l'auteur.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal addresses the challenge and is exploring an opportunity in Indonesia: the lack of local content about Cardano. 

But it still could be improved by adding detailed explanations about the problem and challenges they might face within their own solution.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposers have indicated evidence of their expertise. But the plan presented might be unfeasible in terms of budget and timestamps. The proposal has not given an explanation on quality indicators (what makes them a high-quality "one-stop" hub?). Detailing this aspect a bit would bring more credibility to the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The flow of the community contribution is not clear. The platform aims to be "driven by the community", but proposers have not clarified how this interaction between them, the platform and the community will take form in the short or middle term. I suggest improving this explanation in the proposal, otherwise, it is not easy to audit in terms of assessing the implementation of the solution.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identified the problem of the lack of a reliable source of information about the Cardano in Bahasa Indonesia. As a solution we proposed the creation of a web portal in Bahasa Indonesia about Cardano. I think this is a great idea to increase the participation of Indonesians in the Cardano community. This proposal is in line with the multilingual challenge as it has the potential to engage non-English speakers at Cardano. The proposal does not present a plan to remain financially sustainable in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer identifies who the team members are and provides evidence of their skills/experiences. The budget was very detailed and seems reasonable for the work to be done. The established deadline seems adequate to reach the established goals. The proposal presents a detailed plan explaining everything that will be done. The proposal does not pose risks for its implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal presents in a clear and detailed way the target problem and its solution. It presents a roadmap with milestones, important for tracking the project's progress. It also provides KPIs to monitor job success.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated namely there is no 'one-stop' trusted source for everything about Cardano for in Bahasa Indonesia.It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief by providing such a one stop trusted source.
This proposal shows clearly how it adds value to the Cardano system as it would enable  viewers to understand everything about Cardano web portal in Bahasa Indonesia. Key metrics are clear, reasonable and realistic. THese include  measuring increased awareness of the web portal, how much of contribution was happening from the community, how many articles, guides and newsletters are published each week, how many meetups took place. 
The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge. Proposal can scale to address future challenges by increasing the numbers of publications, and guides that are created and meetups which are held. This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the awareness and trust  among Indonesians regarding Information they receive on Cardano. I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. 
I have given this proposal a 4 star rating because it has gone into great detail and shown a realistic and reasonable understanding of the scope of work as well as a very reasonable budget.

If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has   provided evidence  of himself  where he is a speaker and Town Hall organizer. He has included his LinkedIn profile.
 
He has included his team members portfolios and profile links. There are two links.IF this is the core leadership it maybe sufficient.  But other team members should ideally be included. Yes I visited the profiles. The proposer is competent to build this site and other publications.
The proposal  gives details of other partners which are stake pools. 
He has provided the team structure and breakdown given as in named individuals.

 The budget has  been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. Clear costs have been given for the various full time roles, and marketing campaign as well as software (Zoom) subscriptions.
The budget is  very reasonable to achieve the set goals. 
 The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required. There is no plan for additional funding if objectives are not met. 
The timetable is realstic to build the site and related publications.
The proposal  does  provide  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation. It has a very practical plan with detailed breakdown in terms of the various stages of site production. 
Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are well described.    
The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal. Given experience and plan presented I can agree that it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 

A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities

Given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully hence I have given a 4 star rating
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clear roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. 
 
There are  clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal  they could define number of subscribers, number of Monthly web visits , how many articles from the community,   no of feedback comments.
There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem. 
The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties. I can say that I agree that the proposer has provided sufficient information to audit process and success of the proposal. 


Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.


The information provided is somewhat sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence i have given a 4 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0:
Indonesia is the 4th largest country in the world in terms of population, and the Bahasa is the national language. Exposing that population to information around the Cardano ecosystem, may attract the interest of mant amongst them to adopt it.
Create a portal containing information in Bahasa is the solution recommended by proposers of this proposal. This is in alignment with the challenge objective
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal looks for me missing some valuable information, espcially on how will the project be executed, practicallly. Nothing is mentioned about the firm, or person or people who«,ll take of the translation, knowing this has to be done by a Professional, since translated information will be exposed to the public.
Also don't whether the pproposers thought about reaching out to those who don't have accee to the Internet. Among those people, they may have somme may be interested by the Cardano information and resources.
f6_assessments.q2: My worry is to see the proposal not be completed by lack of financial resources. This may be a risk, or may lead to an project uncomplished.

f6_assessments.q0: As this is a multilingual challenge, providing a easy way to Indonesia to access cardano information and learn about it fits in the challenge. The simplicity they will try to apply to the information will help people from many fields to understand everything
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is detailed in the proposal and they provide infomration about the 3 team members. They cover 3 different fields with the team members and the plan presented is well structured so for sure they can implement it
f6_assessments.q2: Providing key metrics are provided. They are measureble ones son they will be very helpful for auditing the progress. Also how to get if the project is having success is explained, so this proposal is easily auditable

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has an elaborate plan explaining what their goal is and how they will achieve it. Their image of success is having an Indonesian web portal about Cardano with monthly visits and newsletter subscribers.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer/s have lots experience in this area as their group includes a Cardano meetup speaker and a Town Hall member. Their plan is also clear and easy to understand. They have a timeline and an explained and reasonable budget.
f6_assessments.q2: Their timeline is wellwritten and shows clearly what they want to do and all the steps to get there. It is clear and succinct. They have written what they want to do and how they will do it in each month of the 3 month period.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal provide clear problem within the challenge. If we google cardano indonesia , we found nothing that can help people in Indonesia to explore more about cardano , the ecosystem and explain about blockchain itself. I believe this proposal will have great contributes in cardano ecosystem in Indonesia. For the scalability , is highly scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal provide the credential needed to conduct a preliminary assessment of this proposers capacity to archive on their deliverable. The proposal also provide verifiable plan in this regard. The budget is also very reasonable, but i believe the proposal need more budget for advertising and marketing.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has provide sufficient information in details and most likely archive the  intended deliverables. Roadmaps, KPI, correlation between problem and solution is explained in detail.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea to make one-stop website for Indonesian people are great! There's one future challenge after the One-Stop Website going live (specifically after 3 months of the project). Proposer hoping "active community contribution to support the content of the portal" as a success. We should consider community contribution as a challenge too. While hoping the community will create articles about cardano itself, How to make them keep actively contribute make articles for the website? Rewards mechanism, tips from community for contents creator, hot articles in front of the landing page can make community keep active.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very clear links and resources from Google Trends and EF's Paper. Team members' experiences are enough to initiate this project and catch up the timetable. Budgets are reasonable, but some budget are not too convincing.
1. $150 Zoom Pro pricing. From the Zoom Official Website the pricing just need $15/months or $90 for 6 months. Proposer put "upgradeable" in the proposal but not detailed down what to upgrade.
2. $900 for Web Admin maintaining the website (3-6 months). What we do after 6 months? Are all websites need constant maintenance? If proposer could detailed down, it will be great!
f6_assessments.q2: Proposal is well explained and understandable. While the success of this proposal are growing-contributive community and the awareness of this website is increasing, the only way to view those two goals can not publicly audited because number of the visitors of the website can only view by the website creator / moderator. If the proposal is going to be approved, proposer task should make the number visitors can be viewed publicly.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal address the problem statement of the challenge, which is creating a 'one-stop' trusted source for everything Cardano in Bahasa Indonesia. By creating this web portal for local community it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. Since this is a one-stop web portal, it will be able to scale in the future by being able to provide relevant information following the development of Cardano development progress.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal address the challenge problem and add value to the community through building a hub for Indonesian people. Although the team details and information is provided, my concern lies at the web developer profile. There's not enough evidence about their experience regarding web development, it's rather only showcase about the Graphic designer and Illustrator skill experience. Because this is a website product, so this criteria is crucial for the success of this proposal. The budget isn't broken down enough (work hours, etc.), but it is sufficient to outline the need for each role and category. Developing a website in 3 months is not an easy fit, unless it is not an interactive website and only a static website with content updated by the developer or maintainer. It would be better if there's more comprehensive explanation on the website is being developed, such as what are the tech stack, how it will be maintained, the step for implementing SEO (Search engine optimization), etc. Overall, good proposed solution, but lack of promising experience needed regarding the web development area, which is the crucial part of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There are roadmaps and key metrics explained in general. However the roadmap after 2 months didn't get much explanation other than the ranking in Google search result. It would be better if they could split the web development on the first month to second month, while also working on SEO, since the first month seems to be more busy. I've also have a concern regarding the auditability of visitor statistic. It would mean we (the auditor) would have to trust the developer regarding the number of visitor reported, because only the admin of the website knows. Other than that, this proposal is auditable through checking how the actual website is progressing, the ranking on Google search, and looking at the articles created.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge very effectively and delivers a thorough plan to build Cardano community web portal to provide a one-stop easy to understand everything about Cardano web portal in Bahasa Indonesia which driven by the community. Currently, the only reliable source of information about cardano in Indonesia is coming from news portal who rarely cover positive side of crypto, let alone cardano. Providing community driven web portal in bahasa Indonesia will sure be an effective way to answer the problem. The budget requested is very reasonable and affordable with huge potential impact to the community. This is certainly a project that should not be passed.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the combined experience presented by its team member, it is highly likely that the project can be a huge success. Deliverables, timeframe, and goals of this project are very achievable. Furthermore, the team provides milestones and detailed roadmap for three months and requested a reasonable budget. Problem statement and solution delivered match and both address the challenge effectively. The project is also supported by local SPO which could boost the community involvement. The only concern is the proposal does not give a detailed information on how the web portal will be improved and expanded in long term.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the web portal will be the only tools to monitor and audit this project, it should give a sufficient confidence level when the web portal has come to live. Success criteria are relevant and feasible, making it not only auditable but also realistic. However, the team can improve the execution of this project by posting the detailed budget spending on cardano forum so it can be audited by the community member.

f6_assessments.q0: The drive behind this proposal is very much appreciated. It's not an easy task for common users, especially Indonesia's current younger population, to find a true source of information about Cardano because many media nowadays only focus on price/trading actions. It will have a great impact on the growth of Cardano's Indonesia community, in the same way by having this project as a recognized (project catalyst funded) entry point to other activities that will be coming up in the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are legit professionals in their respective fields and aligned with the proposal's objectives. And, the budget plan makes sense, although it doesn't state clearly how long the budget will last (3 months/6 months/ask for another catalyst funding?). Seeing the time frames and goals, they were quite ambitious, but given the backups from local SPO communities, it is an attainable target. The risks won't be from the development side, but the consistency of the project owners or communities to maintain the site.
f6_assessments.q2: Judging from the audit perspective, local communities can have immediate benefits from this portal's presence. It has a clear roadmap, but it should have more specific or exact metrics for evaluation, for example, 10,000 users, 8,000 subscribers, 100 contributors, 50 meetups, etc.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very concise and comprehensive, seeking to set up a one stop web portal in Bahasa Indonesian language where people go to learn about Cardano blockchain. The main goal is to increase awareness of the web portal itself and knowledge about all that Cardano blockchain is. The challenge is effectively addressed.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of 3 experts with skills as business development and project Manager, Cardano Hub Jakarta Meetup speaker, Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall member; Graphic Designer, Illustrator, Web Developer, Entrepreneur, Bogger and Translator, who can successfully implement the proposal. The detailed plan outlined , among others, include Active community contribution to support the content of the portal; Regular community virtual meetups.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map shows 3 months of project work that will be carried out with details provided. First month is Design and implementation, Second month for web portal live and third month for raising number of growth by at least 10% month to date. The budget breakdown is detailed and very comprehensive. Very Good proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal definitely fits into the challenge because building a website to aggregate all about Cardano in Bahasa Indonesia would allow Indonesian people to learn about Cardano, connect to each other to talk about Cardano through the community meetup, and increase Cardano adoption worldwide. I strongly agree the proposal is impactful because the proposal addresses all the objectives in the challenge's success:
    - Increase adoption and community engagement of non-English speakers
    - Increase amount of resources in a variety of languages
    - A sense of community and conversations. Having people around to talk with
f6_assessments.q1:
I preciate the partnership between the team with Indonesian SPO (link provided) and the support of the Eastern Town Hall Indonesia community, the team members' information as well as their experience and relevant skills to the proposal's implementation. That is the good support for the success of the proposal.
Budget is fairly and broken down into identifiable items clearly. It is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
I have some questions to make myself understand more about the proposal:
1. How many articles is the team going to publish each month?
2. What is the (virtual) meet-up content (bi-weekly)?
3. What motivation for community contribution to support the content of the portal?
4. Does the team plan for the portal work itself ? I guess Yes. In the case, what is that plan in details? We well understand that community contribution is strong but we need to have plan to maintain.
Because our support is for the community, we need to listening to the voice of community, so that I recommend the team should add some following milestones in the roadmap after the portal lives (if this is successful):
- Collect viewers /visitors' feedback to polish up the structure.
- Share the portal with Indonesian-speaking community and get feedback.
In summary, I agree the proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
In my opinion, the proposal is auditable. Roadmap with milestone and time horizon make it able to be audited the progress and the success of proposal. I would recommend the proposers should add the exact number of articles that the team is going to publish each month for community (and the challenge team) easier to audit.
I would rate auditability with a score of 4.

f6_assessments.q0: the idea to bring Cardano to the people of Indonesia is a wonderful one. the proposer intends to do this through a website that will hold information on Cardano in the native language. What is not clear is the metrics of success that should align with the goals. Per the setting and the population, how many people does the proser intend to reach out to?
f6_assessments.q1: the proposers have stated their involvement in conference speaking and so I expected to see evidence in the form of pictures and/or videos. Also, it is in a plan to publish four articles per week. This is a laborious task that will need clear evidence of writing skill which is not stated. More so is was not captured in the budget statement.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map of this proposal is clear just that achieving the set milestones may not translate to the goals and success of the challenge. the metrics of success are not measurable. I wish to see figures on how many Indonesian the project intends to reach out to, how are likely to become community members etc. More information is needed to make this proposal auditable.

solution: Un portail web unique et facile à comprendre sur Cardano, en bahasa Indonesia, animé par la communauté.
experience: Directeur du développement commercial et des projets, Cardano Hub Jakarta Conférencier de la réunion, membre de l'équipe de la mairie de l'hémisphère oriental.
